result.execSummary:
The defendant Bennie D Fleming Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 22CF1403, 22CF1469, 22CF442, 11CF271, 11CF273, 11CF324 and 14CM1953. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: 22CF1403, 22CF1469, 22CF442, 11CF271, 11CF273, 11CF324 and 14CM1953.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections. DOC can take 25% of any and all funds in defendant's prisoner account including but not limited to 25% of gifts, wages or other funds.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
State has filed order. No objection.
DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bennie D Fleming Jr

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

*** IN CUSTODY ***

1:43 PM Defendant Bennie D Fleming Jr in court with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1
Court sentences DE to:
-serve 2 years  in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 1 year
-extended supervision: 1 year
-cc to 22CF1403, 22CF1469, 22CF442, 11CF271, 11CF273, 11CF324, and 14CM1953

Challenge Incarceration Program: Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

CONDITIONS
-Maintain full-time employment/education or a combination of both or be seeking same and treatment
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-DNA on file
-Restitution: State has filed Order, No objection.
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge to be paid through DOC
- DOC can take 25% of any and all funds in Defendant's prisoner account including but not limited to 25% of gifts, wagers or other funds

CREDIT
-Days credit for time served: 36 days credit 
-Days credit to Prison: 36 days credit

-DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

1:34 PM Defendant Bennie D Fleming Jr in court with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Waiver of preliminary hearing filed 8/17/22. Parties stipulate to waiver of in-person appearance and acknowledge that probable cause exists that defn committed a felony. Court accepts waiver. Cancels hearing 8/24/22. ARGN to be held by trial branch.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with John B. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 2

3:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bennie D Fleming Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Bennie D Fleming Jr. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
